ud4.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud4.6:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight. He was one who lived in the wilderness, ate only alms-food, wore rag robes, and owned just three robes. He was of few wishes, content, secluded, aloof, and energetic, an advocate of austerities, dedicated to the higher mind.
ud4.6:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ud4.6:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud4.6:4.2_0: and restraint in the monastic code,
ud4.6:4.6_0: this is the instruction of the Buddhas.”
